# Draft:Yorker King

Yorker King is a popular nickname attributed to former Sri Lankan cricketer Lasith Malinga. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest limited-overs bowlers in cricket history and is known for his exceptional ability to bowl deadly yorkers, especially in the death overs.
Background
The term “Yorker King” is used by cricket fans and commentators to describe Malinga’s mastery of the yorker delivery — a full-length ball aimed precisely at the batsman’s feet. His unique sling-arm bowling action and consistent accuracy made him a key bowler in both One Day International (ODI) and Twenty20 International (T20I) cricket.
International career
Lasith Malinga made his international debut for Sri Lanka in 2004 and went on to achieve numerous records:
* Only bowler to take **four wickets in four consecutive balls** on multiple occasions.
* First bowler to claim **100 wickets in T20 Internationals**.
* Took **two hat-tricks in ICC Cricket World Cups**.
* Served as captain of Sri Lanka’s T20I team, leading them to victory in the 2014 ICC World Twenty20.
Recognition
Malinga’s yorker bowling has been widely celebrated by the ICC and cricketing community. The ICC referred to him as the *“Yorker King”* in a feature video published on its official channel, highlighting his dominance in death-over bowling.
Legacy
Lasith Malinga’s yorkers became his trademark weapon, inspiring a generation of fast bowlers around the world. His influence continues in franchise leagues and coaching roles, where he helps train new fast-bowling talents.
